text: End of the day.     An armored truck moves through the ci Los Angeles.
The armored truck pulls up. An ARMORED TRUCK GUARD emerge from the back with a satchel and heads inside.

A large foyer. Security station and elevators. PARTY SOUN can be heard from a second floor balcony. DOUGLAS is the security guard manning the station. Seeing the Armored car Guard entering, he picks up the phone and dials. Beat. Into phone --
Last delivery's finally here. The Armored Truck Guard approaches the security station. he and Douglas exchange paperwork, the Armored Truck Guar references the sounds from upstairs --
Party?
Introducing a new line of jewelry.

Wife wants me to buy her a ruby ring. Told her to spend a little time with the family jewels first. PING. An ELEVATOR opens. A second security guard's inside Handing over the satchel and heading out --
Keep it real.
We see the security guard with the satchel use a key-card gain elevator access to the lower floors. As the elevator doors slide closed...

An exclusive showroom. Display tables empty. At one end o the room, the elevator. At the other end, the open door t a walk-in vault. The ELEVATOR PINGS, and the doors open. The guard emerges with the cart. Pushes it across the room to the outside o the vault. A man in a suit emerges from the vault and starts unloadi the cart into the vault.

A train arrives.   People jostle on and off. One man remains on the platform. MILES. Crisp dresser. Carrying a large leather bag. A cylinder hanging by a str over his shoulder. The train doors begin to close.   When... A fist inserts itself between the doors. They re-open, an a man steps onto the platform. TONY FAIT. Well-dressed. Intense. Fait joins Miles. They watch the train pull out. They check to make sure the station's empty. Then jump off the platform into the tunnel and disappear.
The man in the suit has finished unloading the cart. He closes the heavy vault door and spins a large wheel on th door, securing the vault.

Fait and Miles run down the dark tunnel, staying close to the wall. Miles stumbles. Falls toward the deadly, high- voltage third rail. Out of nowhere, Fait's hand grabs Miles' jacket. Stops hi Just before he hits. Inches from the rail. Fait pulls him back up and away from the danger.
Watch yourself. Miles nods.
Keep it tight. Miles nods again, and they set off.
Sounds of the PARTY continue from upstairs. At the securi station, the guard, Douglas, looks up from a magazine and scans the security monitors.
depicting the empty vault, empty vault anteroom, various empty store areas and the elevator, in which we see the m in the suit riding up.
Douglas settles back in with his magazine.

Fait and Miles reach an access door tagged with paint. starts to open it. Suddenly, the tunnel is filled with the ROAR of an APPROACHING TRAIN. Fait and Miles leap to the wall.   Pre their backs against it as tightly as they can. The TRAIN whooms past, inches from their faces. When it's gone, Miles sighs with relief. Fait cracks the access doo

Fait moves quickly, Miles following. Fait makes fast left and rights, following more spray paint. They branch off into a small dirt-floored space, deep in sub-foundation of a building. Fait stops. Overhead is a flat ceiling. On the ceiling, his flashlight finds a spra painted circle.
Bull's-eye. Without a word, Miles begins assembling equipment.    Fai pulls out a cell phone.
A man, DUNCAN SU, sits in a rental 2002 Thunderbird.

Su's focused, intense, listening to a fancy WALKMAN throu HEADPHONES. We hear what he hears. Only there's no music, just STATIC. Suddenly, on Su's headphones, a PHONE RINGS. Su grows eve more alert. We hear a man with a French accent answer the phone.
Yes?
We're in position.
Delivery confirmed. The stones are there.
Not for long. CLICK.   HISS. Su didn't like what he just heard.       Curses in Chines takes off.

Perched on the side of a cliff above the Pacific, next to the park. The top floor is at street level. Su easily gains access to the roof of the building. He moves to an exact position just at the ocean-side edge. I an eight-story drop. Su faces in.      And then... Hops backward off the roof. Falling feet-first through the air, Su momentarily grabs onto an eight-floor balcony rail, slowing his descent, th lets go. Momentarily grabs a seventh-floor rail and lets go. Grabs sixth-floor rail. Hangs on this time. Vaults lightly onto the balcony.
A large, free-standing FISH TANK BUBBLES away. Nearby, CHRISTOPHE is packing to leave town. When...
Where are the stones? Christophe turns.       Sees Su standing behind him.
(French accent)
Who the fuck are you? Wham.   The Chinese boxing version of a bitch-slap.
Who's getting them for you?
Fuck off. Wham!   Wham!   Wham!     Wham!   Much more violent than slap.
I'll tell you.
I know.
A plasma torch burns through the metal-reinforced slab overhead. Fait taps Miles, who turns off the torch. Fait hammers at the last layer. And...
A hole appears under the private display table, where it can't be seen by the room's security camera.
Fait communicates via a high-tech, transmitting/receiving earwig.
Daria.
Douglas looks up from his magazine and checks the securit monitors again. Everything a-okay.
A limo pulls up outside.
A uniformed chauffeur gets out of the limo, moves to the back and opens the door. A very attractive woman in a short, tight dress emerges.
Escorted by the chauffeur, the woman, DARIA, enters. She approaches the security station. Up close, in the light, Daria's even more alluring. And knows how to wield it.
I'm here for the reception.
Name, please?
Angie Rawlins. Douglas scans a list of names.      Checks off hers.
Thank you. You can go on up.       Front elevator, to the mezzanine. Daria turns toward the elevator. Then doesn't go. Just glances up toward the party, suddenly unenthusiastic.
... I hate these things.      Don't you hate these things?
I'm just here to do my job. Daria looks back at Douglas.      Studies him a moment. what she sees.
Then again, you never know who you're going to meet... She shifts her wrap, baring cleavage.      Then leans ove desk. Giving Douglas an eyeful.
I'll bet you're a lot more fun than any of those boring people upstairs. Douglas is unaffected.   Just looks at her blankly.
Really, ma'am.   I have a job to do. Daria doesn't understand why he's not interested in her. Then she glimpses Douglas's magazine lying on the desk.
The magazine is Genre.   Males for males.   Buff boys. pecs, big penises.
Daria steps back.
Well, I suppose I should go up and see what they're selling. Daria turns back and calls to her chauffeur, TOMMY.
Tommy... What happens next happens very quickly and sotto voce, as Daria walks toward Tommy: She whispers into a hidden mike --
Change of plans. He's gay. Tommy hears it over his earwig.
No way.
Yeah way.
Fait and Miles have heard it, too.   Into his mike --
Tommy.    Your turn.
A look of alarm on Tommy's face.    Into his mike --
Uh-uh.
This isn't a conversation.    Do it. It's an order.    Tommy knows he has to.   Shit.
Shit.
Key-card. Then, still to Tommy, her voice again at normal volume --

Why don't you keep my purse?     I shouldn't be too long. Daria hands Tommy her purse. Palms the key-card from him. Then heads toward the elevator, as... Tommy replaces the sick look on his face. Does his best t look flirty as he walks over to the security station. Lea over the desk with a yummy-smile on his face.
... Aloha. (NOTE: The following scene is INTERCUT with Scenes 20 thru 28.) Douglas looks up from his magazine.
Hi.
I hope you don't take offense at this... but I just have such a weakness for a man in uniform.
If that's your thing...
Uniform's definitely my thing. I mean, I see a sailor, I'm thinking, mmm, seafood. Y'know?
I'm not actually supposed to be
talking on duty.
Who's talking? Honey, this is a flirting... But you're probably just another good-looking man wasting it all on women. World's full of fools. Beat.   Douglas lets him see the Genre magazine.
Yahtzee!... Okay, Mr. I-Always-Have- A-Hard-Nightstick. Put away the pictures of those underfed, white males and let's broaden your horizons.

I like sunsets and puppy dogs, and I'm big in the pants. Just hope I'm not too cute for you. And don't tell me it's a color thing, hon, or I'll come over there and slap a little discrimination right upside your yummy little cheeks.
I'm hooked up.
Another big, hot, cuddly, black love- Jesus got there first. That bitch. Taking you. From me.
Sorry.

Hey... This day and age, sweetie, I can appreciate the monogamy. Saving it for your number one is keeping the world safe, and it's okay by me. Even if you are just breaking my heart... Guess I'll just have to come in here someday, let you catch me shoplifting and resist arrest -- just to have you wrestle me down and cuff me.
I can be pretty rough.
Don't you get me all excited now.   I was just learning to accept my disappointment.
Tommy sticks out his hand.
Tommy.     But you can call me Rachel. Shaking hands --
Douglas. And, man, I really gotta get back to what I'm supposed to be doing, okay? He looks away.     Scans the monitors.
Everything looks normal.
Seeing Douglas is unaware of what's happening in the vaul Tommy relaxes.
I'll leave you alone. But is it okay if I just stand here and stare at the muscles I'll be missing for the rest of my life? OFF which...
Daria gets in. Looks back to make sure Tommy has Douglas' attention. He does. Instead of going up, Daria uses the key-card to access th controls to go down.
As the doors close, Daria shoots a wink back at...
who furtively flips her the bird.        Never missing a Douglas.
Fait emerges from the hole beneath the table.
On the monitors, we see Fait in the vault anteroom and Da descending in the elevator as Tommy keeps Douglas's attention diverted.
Fait holds a small digital camera next to the room's security camera. Mimicking the security camera's slow pan Fait films the room. When he's done....
We see the panning shot of the room on the monitor. Fait pulls up an on-screen menu, clicks on "Repeat." Whereupon the mini-movie begins playing in a continuous loop.
As Fait mounts his camera in front of the security camera Daria steps off the elevator, putting her hair up, ready work.
On the anteroom monitor, we see the monitor on Fait's cam slide into position, making the room look empty, as Tommy continues diverting Douglas's attention.

Fait and Daria push the display table aside as Miles shov equipment bags through the hole in the floor. Fait opens the leather bag, revealing tools, a tripod, th steel cables and a long, rectangular box. Miles grabs a high-tech DRILL. Begins BORING a hole high up on the vaul door. Fait hands Daria the tripod to set up, while he uncoils t steel cables, attaches them to the wheel on the vault doo Then opens the rectangular box and lifts out what's insid A surface-to-air missile. Fait sets it on the tripod.

Miles, the hole drilled, picks up the cylinder he'd had slung over his shoulder. Pulls out a pressurized metal canister of liquid nitrogen. Miles injects the nitrogen into the hole. A CRACKLING sou as the super-low-temp LIQUID spreads out inside the vault door. The outside frosts over. Fait finishes attaching the free ends of the cables to cl on the SAM. Final checks of the rig.
Out.
Speeding through L.A.   Calling 911 on a cell phone.
... I want to report a crime in progress.
Fait is the last one down through the hole.   Beat.    He at the others.
Faith.
Faith.
Faith. Fait pulls out a remote control firing device.   He pushe the button. And...
The SAM IGNITES with a blinding flash and streaks across room. The steel cables instantly snap taut and... RIP the vault's wheel and frozen locking mechanism right the fuck out of the door.
They felt a rumble.   Tommy covers --
Earthquake.
Douglas checks the monitors.      Everything looks okay.
Bet you know how to hit a ten on the Richter scale...
The crew re-emerges through the floor to find the vault d in pieces and a hole the size of a Sub Zero where the SAM augured into the opposite wall.
Holy shit... Fait's already swinging open the vault.

This will trigger the silent alarm. Let's go. We got eleven minutes. Miles moves down the rows of   drawers, using a tool to p all the locks. Fait and Daria   follow behind, quickly pu out the drawers and emptying   jewels into nylon bags. Fa empties drawer after drawer.    All white diamonds. When. He opens a drawer containing various colored diamonds. stops, admiring them.
... I love colored stones... Look at this... He holds up a small, faceted blue diamond.
Two-point-seven million. Into the bag.
Whose shit we stealing, anyway?
Drug dealers and money launderers.
Works for me. Then something else catches his eye. He holds up a small, pink diamond on a chain. Admires it.
This I can use.
And pockets it.
Fait moves to her. Daria's fishing into a nylon bag she found in a drawer. Pulls out a handful of... Large black diamonds. Many more in the bag.
Pow. He takes the bag. Stows it in his jacket. When... Suddenly, Fait's CELL PHONE RINGS. Surprising them.   Bea Fait answers.
Go.
Su's speeding through Los Angeles streets.
Your employer betrayed you. The police are on the way. Leave the black stones.
Who is this?
You know the ones I mean.
Don't think I'll do that. Fait just hangs up.
Tommy and Douglas hear APPROACHING SIRENS. The SIRENS STO outside. SWAT, cops, the works. All heading for the front door. Tommy whispers urgently into his mike.
Shit.  Five-0 at the do'. (then, aloud to Douglas)
Better move my car.
Fait grabs a bag of jewels.
Go time.     Leave the rest.
SWAT swarms in. Tommy exits behind them.
Tommy gets in.    A SWAT COP signals him.
Move it out.
Fait, Miles, and Daria run.
Slam! Fait, Miles, and Daria blast out the access door. Fait kneels, feels the track.
Stopped the trains. (then)
We're in the rabbit hole, they're sending down the snakes. (then)
Daria comes with me. (to Miles)
I got no idea where you should go, but you know where to end up. Miles nods.
Faith.
Faith.
Su studies a computer map of downtown as he drives.
running like hell. Rounds a curve.      Ahead are the rea lights of a stopped train.
Approaching the front of another train, stopped at a station. Fait signals Daria to stay put. Then pokes his head around the corner of the train.
SWAT cops hustle passengers off the train. One SWAT GUY helps another up to check the top of the train. The SECON COP jumps back down.
All clear.

Fait turns back to Daria. Signals her to climb up onto th top of the train. Then begins climbing after her. As Fait reaches the driver's window, he sees ANOTHER SWAT COP approaching the train's DRIVER, checking under seats, etc. Fait has to climb fast. The SWAT Guy and the Driver getti closer. Looking up. Just as...
Fait's leg just clears the window.      They don't see it But...
As Fait rolls onto the top of the train...
The NOISE causes the SWAT Cop to react.      To the Drive
Hold it.
A moment, as they stop and the Cop looks around.    The C checks the Driver's compartment. Nothing.
(radios)
Train's clear. The Cop exits.    The Driver enters his compartment.
ANOTHER SWAT COP stands outside the Driver's window.
Okay to go?

Just hang tight. During which, just above them... Fait and Daria lie very still. Daria's tense. Fait winks her, trying to relax her. Daria's still tense. He raises eyebrows slightly. Shifts his gaze down. She doesn't get it. Finally follows his gaze. Sees her position is giving him a full view of her cleavage. She looks back at him in disbelief.
Nice. That does it. She relaxes and smiles back. Under which a voice crackles over the SWAT Cop's radio.
All clear.
(to Driver)
Okay.    Get this train outta here. Whereupon the train jerks to a start.

running toward the rear of the stopped train.   Leaping o the rear steps. When... Out of nowhere, a foot catches him in the head, sending h flying back down onto the rails. And... There is Su in front of him.
The stones.

You'll have to come and get 'em. Su moves on Miles. Miles throws a solid punch at him. Su and Miles fight on the track behind the stopped train. Th deadly third rail making the fight even more dangerous. Miles is a street boxer. He's good. He's ferocious. But he's no match for Su. When Miles is subdued, Su grabs the bag of jewels, makes sure Miles doesn't have any more, th goes.

Rocketing underground. The tunnel ceiling whizzes by abov Fait and Daria. Intermittent tunnel fixtures just inches from their heads. Every time the train takes a curve, they both slide towar the edge. Fait places a calming hand on top of Daria's. T car takes a wide curve. Daria's body flips to the side. She loses her grip. Screams as she starts to fall off the train. Fait reaches for Daria, losing his grip on his bag, which plummets off the train. Fait can't grab her. The train jerks again. He starts sliding away from her, off the opposite side. Fait thrust out both hands as far as he can. And... Just snags her at the last second. Grips Daria's wrists with all he's got. They're now draped across the curved r of the train. Hands in the middle. If Daria slips, or Fai lets her go, they both die.

Su gets in. Empties Miles' nylon bag into his lap. A fortune in gems and jewelry pours out. Su sifts through i increasingly agitated. What he wants isn't there. He thro the bag down, cursing in Chinese.
Fait is at his limit. His grip starts to loosen. When the train begins to slow. They pull into a station and stop. Fait releases Daria, and she drops to the platform.

Fait jumps down on the other side. He's lost the bag of jewels. Knows they're gone for good. He feels for the bag of black diamonds. Still has them. Unseen, Fait joins Daria on the platform, and, hand in ha they melt into the crowd of commuters.

A stretch limo and a Cadillac Escalade wait on the tarmac next to a Gulfstream, which has just arrived. The jet door opens, and a man emerges with a bodyguard. T man, LING, is Asian, about forty. Emanates grace and powe As Ling descends the steps, and two thugs from the SUV go retrieve baggage... A woman steps out of the waiting limo to greet Ling.   Sh also Asian. Dressed in American casual. Beautiful.     SO She's not smiling. As Ling approaches her --
Enjoying California? CHARLES, the bodyguard, answers for himself.
Hope we're not here long.    I hate sunshine. Ling kisses Sona on the lips.    Then --
We may have a problem. Ling's mood quickly darkens.
The stones?
The exchange was just robbed.
... Let's hope that was part of the plan.
Swarming with police. When... Su steps off the elevator. He's carrying the bag of jewels he took from Miles. To a
Who's in charge?
Who wants to know? Su flashes I.D. We don't see it.   The Cop scopes it a moment. He's clearly impressed.
Follow me. As he leads Su toward his superiors in the vault...
VANESSA, eight, is in her pajamas, playing SIM Coaster on her computer. The door opens. Fait enters. His daughter.
You know it's past your bedtime.
Just a little longer.
(imitating sweetly)
'Just a little longer'... School tomorrow, baby. Let's go. Vanessa sighs. Fait stands over her as she shuts down the computer, talking her through the commands, making sure s doesn't dawdle. FAIT
'Exit.' 'Quit.' 'Do not save.' 'Special.' 'Shut down.' Sleepy- time. Whereupon he whisks her out of her chair, flies her once around the room and tucks her into bed.
You bag some Z's now, you hear?
Okay.
... Wait a second.
What?
I think there's something behind your
ear.

Oh, please, that is so lame.     It's in your hand. She takes his right hand, opens it and turns it over. Nothing. Takes his left hand, opens it and turns it over. More nothing. She's stumped. Fait smiles. Puts his hands together. When he opens them, there is the pink diamond pendant on the chain.
How'd you do that? Fait slips the chain over her head and kisses her.
Good night. Then Fait looks up.     Addresses the air above her.

Angels east, angels west, north and south, do your best. Guard her, watch her, while she rests. A bedtime ritual. Fait goes. When she's alone, Vanessa holds up the diamond, which catches every bit of availabl light and shines in the dark. Then she rolls over and closes her eyes.
Fait enters.     Vanessa's nanny, TONITA, is there.    To
She'll stay down now.
She won't listen to me lately.     Only you.
I'll have a talk with her about it tomorrow. Still to the nanny --
I got some work to do in the office. You can go on to bed.
I'm watching TV, if you need me. Fait exits.
Fait enters.    Tommy and Daria are there.
What the hell happened? Fait puts a finger to his lips.    Leads them across the to another door.
They enter.    Fait shuts the door.
Should we be considering a long vacation in a warm, foreign climate where there's no extradition? Fait's thinking it through.
The guy who called was only interested in the black stones...
Christophe sold us out.
Or something. Just then, Miles enters.
You made it.
By the skin of my ass. Some Chinese dude kicked me around the motherfuckin' block. Busted my ear piece. He takes the broken communication device out of his ear a tosses it on the table.
Snagged my loot, too... Maybe time to
rethink the no-gun policy.
Little ass-whuppin's nothing. 'Least you didn't have to play all foxy with the rent-a-cop. Fait pulls out the bag of black diamonds.
Means this is all we got.
So what do we do?
You all wait to hear from me.
Where're you going?
To get some answers. Miles moves to go with him.
I got your back.
No. I got us into this.     I'll call you if I need you. Daria moves to him.   Their eyes meet.
Be careful. Fait gives her a kiss.   Then goes.

Christophe's arms are   wrapped around the large fish tan one arm over the top,   the other through the legs of the stand. His hands are    bound. He can't move. His beaten face is pressed to the   glass. Large, weird fish swim pa in front of him. The weird fish scatter as a face appears on the other sid of the tank. Ling. Looking through at Christophe. Ling straightens and walks around the tank. Sona is with him. So is Charles, the bodyguard. In b.g., the two thugs stand sentry near the front door. Christophe's eyes follo them.
So this is Mr. Christophe?
Yes. Only the handcuffs and fish tank are a new look.
Apparently we're not his first visitors today.
Please, Monsieur Ling -- Ling interrupts him with a hand on the shoulder.
Whatever you're going to say... Make it the truth.

Sitting in the middle of the large lot, which is full of goods and military surplus equipment. The tank's turret i spinning around. The cannon elevating and depressing seemingly at random. When... The cannon stops. Having locked on...Fait, standing in front of the tank. From inside the tank, a muffled voice.
Bang. A hatch opens. ARCHIE, a fairly straight-ahead-looking ma pops his head up out of the tank.
Like it?
It's cool. As Archie climbs out of the tank and joins Fait --

Want it? Give you a good deal. Ammo included... Reactive armor, twin M240 machine guns, 120mm smoothbore cannon. Guaranteed to get you through the rougher areas of the city and keep the neighbors in line.
Pass.
How about a Marine Corps assault hovercraft?
I got other business. Fait and Archie walk to a work table. Nearby, two MEN UNLOAD HOT TVS from a truck. One Man calls to Archie.
We're outta room over here, Arch.
Stack 'em in the office, if you have to. Then Archie turns his attention back to Fait.
... You weren't downtown tonight by any chance, were you, Tony?
Don't know what you're talking about.
Me either.
Ever see black diamonds before?

White, blue, yellow, pink. Neil Diamond. Lou Diamond Phillips. Black diamonds? Solid rocks? No. Whereupon Fait opens the nylon bag and pours the black diamonds out onto the table. Archie pulls out a loup. Studies them a moment. Shrugs.
You got me.
Find out how much they're worth.
There a timetable on this, or --
Yesterday.
That's what I figured.
Fait's heading out.
I'll be back. I gotta go fuck over a guy who fucked me over.
Fait opens a door with an electronic lock pick.

Fait enters. Stops a moment, his back against the closed door, while his eyes adjust to the dark. Then moves quiet out into the room. Looking for Christophe. Fait continues moving around through the room. When he steps in something wet. He bends down and checks it out. Water. The carpet's soaked. His eyes go to something. Fait finds a cord and turns on switch. The light in the fish tank snaps on. REVEAL Christophe.     Stuffed inside the tank.     Sleep the fishes.
Looks dead to me. Behind him.   Fait turns around.      Sees Su.   Sitting sofa.
Guess you got to him first.
Not me.     Someone else. Fait does the math.
... You're the one who called me. The one who took on my guy... Who the fuck are you, man?
My name is Su.
Cool.     I'm Sally.
I want the black stones.
Yeah?   Make me an offer. Su stands.
You can walk out of here.

... No deal. Fait launches   himself at Su. Gonna fight     his way door. A much    better fighter than Miles.     And... by the bell:    the PHONE RINGS. The fight     stops. phone's near   Fait. Beat. The answering      machine
Christophe here. Leave a message. BEEP.
I know you're there, Mr. Fait. Beat.   Fait pushes the button for the speakerphone.
Who's this?
Overlooking L.A. Ling and Sona. Enjoying hotel room service. Ling's on a cell phone.
The man for   whom Mr. Christophe arranged to   have the black stones brought into   the country and deposited at   the jewelry exchange. The man who   wants them back. Now.
Fine.   How much?
Maybe you didn't understand me.    The stones are already mine.
I got 'em, I'm selling 'em. So get your bid in or go fuck yourself.
I don't have time for this.
That your final offer?
I can be a very dangerous man, Mr. Fait. Fait just hangs up.

Everybody think I'm the fucking Goodwill or something...? Look, I've had a shitty night, and so far, I got zip for all my troubles. So I don't know who the fuck you are, and I don't care. But hear this: you can beat my ass around the block all night -- Brother, it ain't gonna get you those stones. A long beat. The two men facing off. Then... As Su stands aside, giving Fait a clear path out...
Fait slides into his Porsche and drives off.
Fait's checking his rearview mirror. Sees a black Cadilla Escalade pull away from the curb and follow. Fait doesn't need it.

Oh, man... He's about    to punch it. When... A cop car turns a corn and falls    in beside him. Fait throttles back. Keeps driving.     Until, finally... The cops turn off. And now Fait hits    it. Until... Traffic ahead forces Fait to turn into an alley in a semi industrial area. Behind him, the Escalade tries to follow but is cut off by the on-coming cars. We STAY WITH Fait. He GUNS down the alley. Reaches an intersecting alley. Turns. GUNS it out of sight.

Finally forcing its way through on-coming traffic and speeding down the alley after Fait. The ESCALADE reaches intersection. Turns. And... CRASHES into a DUMPSTER rolle into its path. The dumpster forces the Escalade into a wall.

Two men start to get out of the Escalade. We recognize them: Ling's two thugs. We barely have time to realize that Fait's escape has been blocked by construction equipment down the alley. He's had no choice but to turn and fight. Which is what he does, rushing the passenger. The battle's ferocious and fast. Ultimately, Fait's out- muscled and out-gunned. He's forced back against the open door of the Escalade, guns to his head.
Give us the stones.
Man, how many times I gotta tell people: I'm a business man. Make me a motherfucking offer.
Here's your offer. He cocks his pistol.   Beat.
That shit ain't gonna do it, biggie. 'Cause I ain't scared of guns, and I ain't got the stones.
Then you're gonna tell us where they are. Whereupon a...
Spins through the air. The bottle knocks the gun from one Killer's hand. The gun skids under a nearby chain-link fence.
the person who threw the bar.   Su. The fight's on.   Two

two. Using all means available. During the battle, a kill tries to reach the gun behind the chain-link fence. Almos gets it. When... Two vicious DOBERMANS, guard dogs for the junkyard behind the fence, leap out of nowhere, SNARLING and SNAPPING and smash into the fence. The killer jumps back, barely escaping with his arm. The fight continues.   Fait and Su wear them down. Behind the fence, the Dobies want flesh. Every time someo crashes into the fence, they're right there trying to get piece. Also, every time someone crashes into the old fence, we s a series of chain-link connections loosen and break. Unti it happens one too many times. The entire fence goes down The dogs are out. The nearest targets: Su and Fait.Su and Fait must now focus their attention on fighting off and evading the ferocious attack dogs. Finally, Su kicks one dog flying. Whip-kicks the other of Fait. The two men run for the Escalade. The dogs are up i flash. Su spots an abandoned car. A rear door is open.

Not today... The catcalls start.    Archie leans into Su.
I know it    wasn't the plan. But if you don't    fight, they're gonna toss us out on    our asses. We might never find the    guy. A long beat.    Su hates this place.   Su hates Archie.
Fait's in handcuffs. A big cut on his head. Being escorte by two COPS to the stairs leading out of the club. To Odion, as they pass him --
He's pretty beat up.
Yeah. Fell down the stairs... Enjoy the jail sex, Fait. As they continue up the stairs --
Better have the E.M.T.s look at his head.
Near, but not too close. The club visible in b.g. Daria, Miles, and Tommy watch as Fait is led into an ambulance. Via earwigs --
We're still here to help you, T.
Anything you want us to do?
Fait's heard.
Not yet. The PARAMEDIC treating him doesn't understand.
What?
Nothing.

His cuffed hands.    Fingers feeling the inside of his be Finding a spot where a small rectangle has been cut into leather. Popping out the rectangle to reveal a hollowed-o recess in the belt. Where... Fait has a hidden handcuff key.
struggling against their duct-tape bonds.   REVEAL...

Vanessa's hands are taped together behind her back. There tape around her feet. Tape over her mouth. The TV is ON nearby, but she's not watching. Vanessa struggles a moment longer, but can't break the ta Finally gives up trying. Just lies there. Tired and scared.

DING! The crowd's yelling and betting as number eight leaves his corner and advances on Su. Su has nothing against number eight. He's just trying to buy time. So he dodges his opponent. Not exactly running. Fighting by not fighting. A target one moment, gone the next. Again and again, number eight swings and misses. Until... Number eight delivers a knockout blow. Unfortunately it's against himself. The momentum of a missed punch carries him headfirst into a metal post. Number eight drops. As the referee counts over number eig Su uses the chance to find...
still checking out the hands of African-American men in the crowd. Not making any friends as he does it.
Number eight's on his feet.    Moving in again.   When...
Suddenly, he sees it.    The ring.

dodges number eight again. Then... Sees Archie signaling he's found the guy. And... Gets nailed by number eight. A solid hit. Exciting the crowd and pumping up number eight Whereupon... Su turns to him and bows.
You win. Su turns, heads out of the cage. The crowd roaring its disapproval. As... The midget Ring Announcer bars Su's path.
No quitting.    Get back in there. Su moves him aside. The midget resists. Five other waitin fighters come to the midget's aid. Forcing Su back into t cage. Where... It's now Su against them all.

Daria, Tommy and Miles wait. Two     extreme MOTO-RIDERS dressed in leathers have pulled up    in a truck and gott to eat. In the back of the truck     is a motorcycle and four-wheel ATV. The two men Ogle     Daria. To her --
Looking good. She ignores them.     To each other, so she can hear --
Nice rack.
Like the upstairs, like the basement,
too.
Shut up, assholes...

Fait's heard. Looks past the Paramedic. Past the Cops talking outside. Sees the hot dog stand in b.g. Sees the truck with the motorcycle and ATV parked near the stand. Paramedic finishes bandaging Fait. To the cops outside --
He's all patched up. A Cop calls inside to Fait.
Let's go. Fait stands.     Starts out.   Into his mike --
Get ready to move. And we see... The handcuffs aren't on him anymore.

Fait reaches the rear doorway.      When... He jumps. Knocks one Cop down.      Shoves another aside. takes off running. Fait's caught the cops completely by surprise. It takes a few moments before the cops give chase, some on foot, oth by car.
Fait runs toward the truck parked by the hot dog stand. To Daria, Miles and Tommy, looking on --
Get the car.     Stay close. As Daria, Miles and Tommy quickly mobilize, Fait jumps in the bed of the truck. Jumps on the ATV. IGNITION. The Moto-Riders suddenly realize what's happening.

Hey! Too late. Fait blasts out of the rear of the truck.   Rig through the nylon mesh tailgate. Fait flies from the truck bed. Lands on the hood of a police car. Gets big air off the windshield. Clears the rest of the car and grabs pavement with all four wheels. As Fait tears off, and cop cars follow, one of the Moto- Riders jumps into the bed of the truck and climbs aboard remaining motorcycle. His friend calls to him --
Don't let that fucker get away! The Moto-Rider FIRES UP the MOTORCYCLE. Drops it into first. Dittoes Fait's leap out the back and SCREAMS off i pursuit.
Vanessa still taped up.    TV still ON.   When...
... We go now to this breaking story...
Airing a chopper shot tracking Fait on the ATV.

... You're watching a man on an all- terrain vehicle leading police in a high-speed chase through downtown Los Angeles. An L.A.P.D. spokesman says the man, Anthony Fait -- Vanessa looks over in surprise.

-- commandeered the A.T.V. after escaping from police officers while being treated at a local hospital for injuries resulting from his earlier arrest for robbery... And this is certainly one of the wildest chases we've witnessed here in L.A...

WHOOOM! Fait's flying. Seventy-plus. Down streets, sidewalks, squeezing through places police cars can't. Over, under, around, through -- doesn't matter. The ATV's fast, strong and maneuverable. One problem: so is the moto-cross bike.     The guy's rig Fait's ass. Matching move with move. Overhead, police choppers follow Fait's every move. While on the ground other police vehicles move to block his pat But whenever Fait meets a roadblock, he somehow finds an escape. At one point, he uses an outdoor escalator. At another point he blasts through the Hotel Bonaventure. This'll be a news highlight for days to come.

The place is bedlam. In the crowd, bets are going down on the battle royal, now in full effect inside the cage. Su versus the five fighters. And the midget. The different fighters use different fighting styles agai Su. Kickboxing, grappling, aikido, kali, American street fighting... Su uses all his own skills and whatever's at hand. At one point he engineers it so one opponent turns on another opponent. At another point, Su wields the midget like a fighting staff. One by one, Su starts reducing the opposition.
Fait's everywhere.   And so is the moto-bike.   Still on tail. Fait veers inside a building.   The bike follows.

Fait and the moto-bike ascend the stairs.   One floor. floors. Up and up. Fait reaches the top-floor hallway.   Nowhere left to go except... Out the window at the end.   And... That's just where he goes.
And where he goes, the moto-bike goes.

The ATV and the moto-bike make the first leap.    Onto th roof of a next-door building. From there, it's rooftop to rooftop.    Jump after jump. Longer and longer. Until... The MOTO-BIKE eats it in a spectacular CRASH.     The mot rider walks away, but his chase is over.
Fait's ATV SCREAMS down another street, still chased by cops. Into his mike --
Yo.
Here.
Above ground parking garage in Chinatown?
Know it.
Get there.

It's down to Su and the kick boxer.    The kick boxer spi and kicks and punches, and... Su just ties the guy up in his own clothes.    Ties him i pretzel. Cinches him tight. Then... Looks for Archie.     Can't find him. Can't find the guy wearing the ring.     And hurries out of the cage.
Fait jukes the ATV in the entrance.    Up the spiral ramp
Moments later, police CARS SKID up and seal the entrance.
On TV, a chopper shot of the garage surrounded by police.
... And it looks like this chase will end here, as police seal off the building... OFF Vanessa, watching...
Su runs into the parking area. Archie's in the T-bird. Sitting, a little unnaturally in the front.
Where is he?
Decided to leave early.
Where'd he go?
Right here. Su looks inside the car.
Where Archie sits atop the man with the diamond pinkie ri Holding a STUN GUN to the guy's cheek.
Good thing I brought my stunner. He ZAPS the air.    Then puts it back to the guy's cheek.
Okay, bud, wanna start the Q and A?
On TV, the chopper zooms in on a familiar car, as it roll down the exit ramp toward the police barricade.
... Here's a car coming down the exit ramp... We see the police approach the car.
... The police apparently talking to the driver... The police let the car pass.

... Now letting this car drive on as the search inside continues... Vanessa notices something about the car.     Looks carefu When... The car turns, giving the news chopper a better zoom angl of the people inside, and... Vanessa sees Daria, Miles and Tommy. Which could mean only one thing:    her daddy's safe.   A soon he'll be coming to get her. With a rekindled hope inspired by her father's escape, Vanessa now looks for a way to free herself from her duct tape bonds. When, just as it's about to seem hopeless again, her eyes go to... Her necklace.   The chain and pink diamond pendant. Vanessa bends over    and lowers her head until the neckl slides off onto the    bed. Then turns around and  picks necklace behind her    back. Holding it as taut as  she c between her hands,    she begins sawing away at the tape her wrists.
The gang's all here.    All eyes on the club.
I knew the stones were in there.
Question is, how do we get 'em out? Place is slamming nonstop. A long beat.    Fait doesn't answer.
Something isn't right.
Yeah.   That's what I'm getting.
The doorman.
... Where the hell is he? (then)
Everyone stay put. OFF which, as he and Su go --
MUSIC pumps downstairs as Su and Fait cautiously move dow the hall toward Chambers' office.
No Chambers' guys.     I don't get it. They reach the closed office door, where they stop and listen. Hear nothing. Su and Fait exchange a "ready-ready" look.     Then Su op the door.
Su and Fait enter, unchallenged, to find... Odion and the other Chambers' men.    Dead.   Skull shot.
I get it now. Su ignores the bodies, quickly moves to the Zen fountain, where he reaches into the water and begins searching the rocks lining the bottom. Beat. Then --
Are they there? Su doesn't answer, still searching.
No. This can't fucking happen.      They gotta be there. Another beat. Then, at last, Su holds something up: black stone. It takes Fait a moment to understand.
... What?     That's it?
The rest are gone. Fait can't believe it.
... What the hell happened?        Who got 'em?
... Ling.
How do you know?
I know.
... How'd he get here before us?
He's good. Beat.   Failure.       Summed up in one word:
Vanessa... (then, trying)

He has the stones. There's      no reason to keep her. Hell, she's a      little girl, she's eight years old     -- she can't hurt him. He can let      her go... He can just fucking let her     go... Su just looks at him.        Not a chance.   And he knows knows it, too. It's over.     For Fait, it's as if his life just ended.
... What the hell am I gonna do?

... We need to go. Fait doesn't move. Then, suddenly, it all explodes as rag and Fait picks up the large, stone ball spinning atop the fountain and, screaming, hurls it into a large display of exotica, destroying it. Beat.   Fait looks at Su, who meets his eyes.          Th
Come on. OFF which, as Su mobilizes him, and they go...
Ling pours the black stones out on a table.   To Sona and Charles --
We're back in business. CHARLES
Good. I don't have to baby-sit much longer.
I hate kids.
Is everything else ready?
We just have to test the device. Russell, who's been working on his scientific contraption nearby, speaks up.

Dye master oscillator. And not test, calibrate. Which I'm now ready to do... Goggles. When the goggles are on, Russell hits a switch.   And... Inside the contraption, brilliant green laser BEAMS begin bombarding a sensor. OFF which...

Vanessa succeeds in using the necklace   as a saw to free wrists from the duct-tape. She quickly    rips the tape f mouth. Untapes her ankles. Then tries     to figure out w next. Begins searching the camper for    anything that mi her escape or fight. When... Looking through the glove box, she finds a cell phone. An old model. So old, it takes her a moment to figure out exactly what it is. Then she pushes "Power," and... The phone turns on.    Sort of.
"Low Batt" flashes on the screen.

Rock bottom. Fait's desolate, sitting on the sofa, staring off.      D tries to comfort him, but it doesn't help. Miles and Tommy stay close and stay silent. Even Archie's quiet for once. The only noise is Su, speaking into a cell phone in Chine to someone who is obviously his superior.

... I lost the stones. Ling has them... I don't know where he is... I have no way to find him... What do you want me to do? Under which, the PHONE begins to RING.    And... Fait's too upset to care about answering.
Vanessa's on the old cell phone.    We hear RINGING on th other end.
... Answer, Daddy, answer...
"Low Batt"... "Low Batt"...
The PHONE'S still RINGING.    After another moment...
Want me to get that? Which finally mobilizes Fait to reach over and answer.
Hello.
Vanessa whispers urgently.
Daddy?
Vanessa! Which gets everyone's attention.
Come get me!   Please!   I want to go home!
Okay, baby, okay. Just calm down. Under which, in b.g., Su quickly ends the phone call to h superior. Still in Chinese --
I'll call you back.
(continuing, to Vanessa)
Where are you?
I don't know. I'm in a van inside a big building. They painted the windows. I can't look out.
Try.   Try to see something. Vanessa puts her eye to the window.    Finally finds a sm gap in the paint.
Few details. Just some chairs and bright green light from Russell's contraption.
"Low Batt"... "Low Batt"...
I see chairs.    And there's green light. Fait repeats for the others' benefit.
You see chairs and green light? Where's the light coming from?
I can't tell.
Is it bright?
The green light, baby -- is it bright?
Yeah.   Really, really bright.
(to Su)
It's real bright.
Daddy, hurry!    I'm scared!
I know, baby.    Just hang in there
Fait's voice drops out as the battery dies.
... Daddy?!   Daddy?!... END INTERCUT.
... Vanessa?... Vanessa!... Shit! Fait slams the phone down in frustration. But Su's mind is on what she told them.
... He's doing it here.    Tonight.
What?
Selling the stones... A dye laser emits green light. He needs it to activate them.
What the hell you talking about?
What are these stones? Archie answers it.
Doomsday in disguise. All eyes go to him.
They're some kinda new synthetic plutonium. Small and portable, but mega-powerful.
This fucker's making bombs?
Not making them.

Yeah, he'd need a big operation for that. Why bother? Just demonstrate the stones work and sell 'em to whichever international scumbag offers the highest bid. He makes millions, they make the bombs, then... 'look out, world.'
... Okay, so we know what he's up to. How's it get us to Vanessa? Su considers it a moment.
The buyers will want to arrive and leave quickly... Somewhere private... Accessible by aircraft.
Vanessa said she's inside a big building. Could be a hangar.
Man, there's dozens of little airports around here. We'd never get to 'em all.
... Flight plans.
Hey, yeah. Flight plans show destinations. All aircraft file 'em with the Aviation Administration. If we could get a list, we could maybe figure out where the sale's going down.

... Daria, call the aviation people. Use our L.A.P.D. credentials. We need flight plan info for all private aircraft in this area tonight... Everyone else get ready to move... Miles, the no-gun policy's revoked. You break out the heat... Tommy, you gotta get us a diversion.
I can help with that.
... Do it all fast.
Ling, Sona, Charles, and Russell. Russell finishes testing his contraption.    Switches it Then, removing his goggles --
We're operational. The others remove their goggles.    Sona checks her watch
The buyers arrive in less then an hour. Beat.   Ling holds up a black stone and examines it.
... So small. So deadly... We're selling conscience for money... A look at the others.   Serious.   Then a broad smile of
consummate satisfaction suddenly spreads across his face.
... But it's a lot of money... Beat.   He puts down the stone.    A glance at the camper
Be ready to kill the girl and go as soon as the sale's over.

head_text.subj: TOPOGRAPHICAL MAP OF LOS ANGELES AREA

text: Fait's finger indicates a spot.
Wick Airfield... PULL BACK TO...
Fait, Su, Daria and Miles.
... Five private choppers arriving tonight within minutes of each other.
Sounds like our best shot.
.. It better be, or my baby's dead. He and Su exchange a look.     Then --
Let's go.
Noselight beaming, the chopper lands next to four other high-end biz copters, including an Agusta A109, outside t hangar, where the bruised Ling killers stand guard.
Vanessa peeks through a void in the paint covering the windows.

An internationally-diverse group of men -- some occupying the chairs, some studying the contraption, some clearly muscle. Across the room, Sona and Ling greet the new arrivals. In all, sixteen men have arrived for the sale. There are five buyers -- one RUSSIAN, one AFRICAN, one PAKISTANI, o EGYPTIAN, one FRENCH. The French Buyer is in a wheelchair Each buyer has brought with him one right-hand man and on to three bodyguards. Vanessa SHIFTS her VIEW, REVEALING... Charles standing nearby.    Too close for her to escape. Charles turns, and...
Quickly, before Charles can see her, she steps away from window. There's no way out.
Driving.   Daria and Miles following in their car.
So tell me... How the hell's Taiwan fit into all this?
One of our scientists made the stones. Tried to go into business for himself. We stopped him. Recovered the stones... Ling betrayed us. He took them.
Ling?   He was one of you?
We were partners. Six of us. He killed the others. He thought he killed me, too.
(beat)
So what're you really after -- the stones or the payback?
Both.
... Yeah... Let's get it all.
You're the world's foremost arms dealers. You all know that weaponry equals power. And in the world of weaponry, nukes rule.
But nuclear material is hard to obtain and difficult to handle... But what if it weren't?... That's the question that brought you here tonight... And here's the answer. Ling holds up a single stone.

In its present state, it's completely inert. Zero radiation, zero volatility... Whereupon Ling places the stone on a piece of velvet on a table. Folds the velvet over. Then, whack, hits it hard with a mallet. He unfolds the velvet.   The stone's smashed to pieces. Ling picks up a sliver of stone and hands it to Russell, places the sliver inside a small ceramic capsule, then inserts the capsule into his contraption.

Goggles on. Everyone puts on goggles. Then Russell hits the switch, a the green lasers bombard the capsule containing the slive of stone, which begins to glow. Russell announces each passing threshold as a numerical readout on the contraption races up the scale --
... Firecracker... .44 magnum... R.P.G... Sidewinder... SCUD... Tomahawk... Daisy Cutter... Hiroshima... two Hiroshimas... And it just keeps going.   Until, finally --
... New World Order. As the buyers absorb this... Russell shuts off the beams.
Goggles off. Russell removes the capsule and hands it back to Ling, wh holds it up.
One small    fragment. Transformed into a source    of immense energy. More powerful    than weapons-grade plutonium a hundred    times its size. A beat as this sinks in.

The purpose of today's sale is to begin trading a new commodity on the black market and establish its value... There are fifty stones available in the first sale. The opening price is one million per stone... Bids, please? The buyers indicate their bids both aloud and by using ha signals a la traders in a commodities exchange pit. At th same time, they're all crunching the numbers on calculato Ling looks on as Sona runs the sale, and Russell uses a laptop to input data and develops supply and demand marke analysis for Sona to consult. The pace starts out slowly and unevenly as the buyers fee out the situation.
Five at one million. Sona is silent.   Silence means "No."
Five at one-point-two. Silence.
Three at two million.
We'll take that.
Six at one-five. Silence.
Ten at two million. Silence.
Near their cars. (NOTE: From now until the battle's over, it's night. At the airport, Fait, Su and Fait's team will all communicat via earwigs.)
Miles, what do you see?
Atop the building next to Ling's hangar. The five chopper rest on the wide tarmac below, between the two buildings. Miles scans Ling's hangar through the scope of a silenced sniper rifle.
FINDING the Ling killers outside the hangar.
Two sentries my side. Then, scanning inside Ling's hangar THROUGH windows --
Sale's at this end... There's a camper with painted windows. Middle of the hangar.
Vanessa said she was in a van. That's gotta be it. (to Daria)
When we get her, you move her outta
there fast.
I'll keep her safe.
Su's reached the top of outside stairs.    Opens a door a enters.
High above the floor, Su steps onto a catwalk.    The sal continuing below. More heated now.
Eight at three. Silence.
Nine at three. Silence.
Ten at three-one.
We'll take that... There are now thirty-seven stones available. And now, in more and more rapid-fire succession --
Five at three-five.
Eight at three-five.
Twenty at three.
Miles.   Sentries.
is already sighted in.   PULLS the TRIGGER.   PHUT!
One Ling killer takes a leg hit and goes down. Before the second killer has time to react, he catches a BULLET in the shoulder.
Done.
Tommy and Archie. Watch out for the camper. Punch it.
The sale's now a frenzy.
Five at five million.
Six at five.
Seven at five.
Ten at five.
Ten at five-one.

Five-two. When suddenly... KA-WHAM! Archie's Abrams TANK BLASTS through a wall and into the hangar. Archie's head pops out of the driver's hole. At the same time, Tommy pops up out of the turret and trains a mounte machine gun on the stunned group.
Freeze, motherfuckers!
Russell watches the advancing tank.
I knew it!   I knew it!
Fait and Daria enter through the hole in the wall using t Abrams for shelter.
Vanessa peers out through a gap in the paint to see what' happening.
Charles is drawn away by the advancing tank.
She looks back into the camper. Finds a heavy iron skille amid the stove utensils. Swings it. And... SMASH!    She SHATTERS a side WINDOW.
We FIND Vanessa, jumping out of the camper.
Vanessa's out of the camper.   Running this way.
To Daria --
Stay. And he's gone, sprinting after her just as...
reaches a button for opening and closing the giant hangar doors. She jabs a button, and the nearest door begins to motor open.
hears the OPENING HANGAR DOOR.    Turns.   Sees Vanessa a goes after her.
Vanessa rolls out under the rising door and runs.
She's out. Then, FINDING Charles coming after her --
There's a guy after her.
A BULLET rips through the collar of his leather coat. Jus behind his neck. Just missing him. But he keeps coming.
Charles rolling out under the door.
SHOOTS again.   PHUT!
The BULLET RICOCHETS off the PAVEMENT right next to him. a flash, he's up and running. Heading out into the darkne of the airfield after Vanessa. Meanwhile, back inside...
In here, the hangar door continues to open as the tank ma its slow approach. Archie's not a great driver. Tommy sweeps the muzzle of the machine gun across the group.
Just be cool! At which point, Russell breaks for his five-ton truck.

I said don't move, motherfucker! Russell just keeps going. Slides open the side door in th back of the five-ton, revealing... A twin-fifty machine g Two barrels, .50 caliber. Dangerous even for a tank. Russell vaults in and takes aim.
Fucking amateurs! He starts FIRING. People start running. .50 CAL. ROUNDS t big CHUNKS out of whatever they hit.
Shit!   What do we do?
Shoot back!

How? The question's answered for him.   He somehow does the ri thing. And... Tommy's MACHINE GUN begins RIPPING CHUNKS out of the FIVE TON and EVERYTHING near it. Tommy's a horrible shot; the gun's more in control of him. But... Russell finally dies under a HAIL of HEAVY LEAD.
Twin .50's some major firepower. How'd that little shit get one?
Motherfucker.    Couldn't fucking listen. INTERCUT WITH which...

Ling and Sona are moving toward the limo. Ling has the stones. When... Su is there. Blocking the way. Sona attacks. Su easily blocks the counters. Knocking Sona bac Never taking his eyes off Ling. When... Sona, who's fallen back against a buyer's bodyguard, quic takes the bodyguard's small, full-auto SCORPION and turns the gun on Su. Su dives for cover as the BURST SHREDS the AREA where he' just been standing. As Sona continues hunting Su... Su se
Ling getting into the limo.    To Archie and   Tommy, as signals --
Don't let him get away! As a result of which...
Having just waxed Russell, see Ling in the limo. Tommy's is out of ammo. He switches to the .30 cal. tank's machin gun. As Archie steers toward the limo, Tommy begins BLAST away.
Ling's trying to drive out, when the .30 CAL. SLUGS PUNCH HOLES in the LIMO. The tank keeps coming. Ling bails out the TANK CRUSHES the LIMO. INTERCUT WITH which...

Play cat and mouse. Su rapidly runs out of room to hide. He can't get away. Su stands. Faces her. Faces the inevitable. When... WHAM! Daria appears from nowhere. Kicks the gun from Sona's hand. To Su, re: Ling, now running from the crushe limo

Get him. Su goes after Ling. And now it's Daria vs. Sona. Sona's a better fighter, but Daria's got passion on her side. It's a good fight. Until, at last, Sona finds the Scorpion. She swings it up. And... Daria executes a sudden, improvised double move that stri Sona's arm in such a way as to cause her to point the SCORPION at herself, just as she FIRES. The burst rips through her chest and kills her. And now, here's what's been going on outside...
As Charles runs from the hangar, chasing Vanessa across t tarmac into the darkness of the airfield...
flips to NIGHT VISION on the sniper-scope.    And...
Charles and Vanessa become clearly visible. Charles is closing in on her. Cross-hairs FIND him. PHUT!
The BULLET knocks his gun from his hands.    Charles is s but keeps going.
Charles reaches the flight line. Parked planes, a gas truck, a shed, etc. He disappears behind the equipment.
sweeps the rifle, looking for Charles and Vanessa.     He Fait.
Lost 'em behind the gas truck.

stops behind the gas truck.   Looks around for Vanessa. sign of her. Until... Charles notices the door to the gas truck isn't closed al the way. He whips it open. And... There's Vanessa, hiding inside. Charles grabs her.   Yanks her out struggling and kicking
Time to end this my way. And then...
Drop the girl.
Charles looks over.    Fait is there, holding a gun on hi Vanessa's relieved and excited to see her father.
Put her down. Charles lowers Vanessa to the ground.    He releases her.

Daddy! Vanessa runs to her father. Dives into his arms. It's a little more energetic than Fait was expecting. And... Suddenly, Charles uses the distraction to rush in behind her. He hits Fait hard. A kick sends the gun flying. Charles keeps coming. Charles keeps pounding. Fait's hampered by Vanessa. She won't let him go. Fait stays between Charles and Vanessa. Guarding his little girl. Barely managing to fend off Charles, a seemingly unstoppable force. The fight winds through the planes, under wings, through struts.
Fait, Charles and Vanessa.    No clear shot.
comms Fait.
No shot.

The fight continues.   Fait's suffering under Charles' br attack. When... Vanessa causes Fait to stumble near a plane.   They fall. Charles moves in. And... Fait's hand goes to a set of chocks set against the plane wheel. The chocks are two heavy wooden blocks connected b a length of nylon rope. Fait turns to Vanessa.

Don't move. Fait jumps to his feet. Swinging the chocks. Not quite like nunchakus; more like a medieval mace. And now, all o Fait's fury comes pouring out as he uses the chocks to be the living shit out of Charles. Charles tries to fight back, but he's out-matched by the chocks and Fait's emoti The punishing blows land like Thor's hammer. Until... A mighty swing nearly takes Charles' head off. Charles is unconscious before he hits the ground. Fait stands over Charles. Tosses the chocks down.
Wrong kid.    Wrong dad. Fait turns. He moves back to where Vanessa's still hiding He scoops her up. And... Father and daughter hold each other tight. Forever. During all of which, also INTERCUT.

Ling, having just escaped being crushed in the limo, runs out just as... Four helicopters take off, one after the other, carrying the buyers away. The fifth chopper, an AGUSTA A109, is POWERED UP, waiting for the wheelchair-bound French Buyer, being helped by a bodyguard. Ling intercepts them. Knocks out the bodyguard and tips over the Frenchman's chair. Then jumps into the Agusta.
Ling puts a gun to the pilot's head.
Go!
Su, having left Daria to fight Sona inside, runs out.
